abstract: Illinois Gov Bruce Rauner proposes over $6 billion in cuts in state spending and asks for steeply reduced pension benefits for state workers; cuts will probably face rigorous opposition in Democratic-controlled legislature.
lead_paragraph: Though many of his cuts are likely to face opposition in the Democratic-led legislature, his proposal for solving the state’s crippling pension crisis may be the most contentious.

headline.main: Illinois Governor Proposes $6 Billion in Cuts and Reducing Pension Benefits
headline.print_headline: Illinois Governor Proposes $6 Billion in Cuts and Reducing Pension Benefits
headline.seo: Gov. Bruce Rauner’s Budget Would Cut Spending on Universities and Health Care

snippet: Though many of his cuts are likely to face opposition in the Democratic-led legislature, his proposal for solving the state’s crippling pension crisis may be the most contentious.
